TLDR: The company does not value you as a player and the game does not value any of your time. We live in a world where games provide incentives to spend time on a game, providing events, content and rewards that are obtainable. Overwatch2 does everything in its power to oppose that by making the player basically pay for everything within the game. This game is not worth pursuing anymore unfortunately, nor is it worth supporting them in any way shape or form. It is truly a disappointment as the game itself had insane potential and yet they basically threw it all in the trash and set it on fire.

I used to love this game. Overwatch 1 was one of the best multiplayer experiences I had playing a game of it's kind (basically a shooter but with Heroes rather than weapons that change around, each with their unique ability).
Despite its faults, it was still a great game and I had accrued about 800 hours before OW2 released.

Now the problem comes from how HORRIBLE the "Sequel" was handled. The players were lied to over and over and over again about so many things, but nothing was as bad as the fact that the MAIN POINT OF CREATING A SEQUEL, literally the main reason they allegedly decided to create a sequel, was cancelled. Sure you might get some bits and pieces, but that was already part of the first game (as part of an event called Archives. AND IT WAS FREE).

This gameplay now remains enjoyable, however, due to all the money grabbing, the terrible choices and many other concerns (such as re-releasing old functionalities (that were removed for no reason) and pretending it's new; or the matchmaking which has never been more broken, an excessive majority of the matches you'll play will be complete stomps (where one team absolutely destroys the other, making it unenjoyable)) makes this a game that in my opinion should be avoided.

Just as an idea skins that before used to be obtainable by either lootboxes (either paid or obtained (you were able to actually obtain a lot of stuff previous in OW1))... now on average cost 20 dollars/euros/pounds, which is absolutely ridiculous. The battle pass does not offer premium currency. And if I recall correctly one needs to do all the weekly/daily? missions for almost a year to be able to purchase 1 single skin.

Companies should suffer from terrible choices and should learn that gameplay and quality is important and should not be abandoned (at least not to the level they did), which is why I highly advise against playing it no matter how fun the gameplay may appear. The longer companies get away with stuff like this the worse it's going to get, up to a point there will be no going back.

This game is literally the most dogshit ass game I have ever played. All blizzard wants is f king money even though they can feed family. These cunts don't know what they are doing, if they just knew PVE is just something that wasn't going to be presented alongside with the squeal of ow. They should have just kept it as OW 1.

good game, bad company. so blizzard, fku :-)

Absolutely ruined potential and the trust of the playerbase

It has its issues but its fun.

Most of my issues revolve around how you get the new heros without $$$
Disgusting company. All the reviews are deserved.

The PvP remains great, but unfortunately that is all there is to like (maybe the custom games too)

The broken promise of PvE is too much of an heart break to the fans to recommend this game to anyone.

GG Blizzard

Turn it back to Buy to Play, make the new heroes free again, take out the 2 and put it back to Overwatch.

I've been playing since OW1 launched. Ignore the hate, the salty susans are always complaining about every little thing. It's a solid game and by far the best team based hero shooter out there. The one major downside is the egregious "micro" transactions, that part is truly disgusting. Your skins are not worth Â£16, no skin is. If they priced things in this game fairly and didn't extort their player base it would be a solid 10 all round. 

as is, it's still a great game which is now free. You don't need to buy anything to jump in and enjoy so give it whirl.
